CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 30, 1939, pg. 2, reads: "Distributed 2,000 Pounds of Candy to Kiddies - Playing the part of a true Santa, George W. Gaines, local mortician, is shown distributing candy from his beautiful new business establishment in Auburn Street, to children on Christmas day. Mr. Gaines also gave candy to children at the Home for Colored Boys, Coleman's Home and Home for the Aged and Infirm Colored Women.  The popular mortician distributed a total of 2,000 pounds of candy."
TitMainTitle: George Gaines distributing boxes of Peter's Chocolate Coating candy to children, including boy wearing argyle socks and knickers, for annual Christmas party at Gaines Funeral home, another version
